Available methods

Source: R/functions.R
methods.Rd

Wrapper functions of available methods for related problems.

Usage

glm.common(x, y, family, alpha = 1)

# S3 method for class 'glm.common'
predict(object, newx)

# S3 method for class 'glm.common'
coef(object)

glm.spls(x, y, family = "gaussian", alpha = 1, nfolds = 10)

# S3 method for class 'glm.spls'
predict(object, newx)

# S3 method for class 'glm.spls'
coef(object)

glm.xrnet(x, y, alpha.init = 0.95, alpha = 1, nfolds = 10, family = "gaussian")

# S3 method for class 'glm.xrnet'
predict(object, newx)

# S3 method for class 'glm.xrnet'
coef(object)

glm.empty(x, y, family, alpha = 1)

glm.separate(x, y, family, alpha = 1, lambda = NULL)

# S3 method for class 'glm.separate'
predict(object, newx)

# S3 method for class 'glm.separate'
coef(object)

glm.mgaussian(x, y, family = "gaussian", alpha = 1)

# S3 method for class 'glm.mgaussian'
predict(object, newx)

# S3 method for class 'glm.mgaussian'
coef(object)

glm.glmtrans(x, y, family = "gaussian", alpha = 1)

# S3 method for class 'glm.glmtrans'
predict(object, newx)

# S3 method for class 'glm.glmtrans'
coef(object)

Arguments

x

feature matrix (multi-task learning) or list of \(q\) feature matrices (transfer learning)

y

response matrix (multi-task learning) or list of \(q\) response vectors (transfer learning)

family

character vector with 1 or \(q\) entries, possible values are "gaussian" and sometimes "binomial" or other

alpha

elastic net mixing parameter: number between 0 and 1

object

output from multi-task learning or transfer learning method

newx

feature matrix (MTL) or list of feature matrices (TL) of testing samples

nfolds

number of cross-validation folds: positive integer

alpha.init

elastic net mixing parameter for initial models: number between 0 and 1

lambda

sequence of regularisation parameters

Examples

# multi-task learning
n_train <- 100
n_test <- 10
p <- 50
q <- 3
family <- "gaussian"
x <- matrix(data=rnorm(n=n_train*p),nrow=n_train,ncol=p)
newx <- matrix(data=rnorm(n=n_test*p),nrow=n_test,ncol=p)
y <- matrix(data=rnorm(n_train*q),nrow=n_train,ncol=q)
object <- glm.empty(x=x,y=y,family=family)
object <- glm.separate(x=x,y=y,family=family)
object <- glm.mgaussian(x=x,y=y,family=family)
object <- glm.spls(x=x,y=y,family=family)
coef(object)

# transfer learning
n_train <- c(100,50)
n_test <- c(10,10)
p <- 50
x <- lapply(X=n_train,function(n) matrix(data=stats::rnorm(n*p),nrow=n,ncol=p))
newx <- lapply(X=n_test,function(n) matrix(data=stats::rnorm(n*p),nrow=n,ncol=p))
y <- lapply(X=n_train,function(n) stats::rnorm(n))
family <- "gaussian"
object <- glm.empty(x=x,y=y,family=family)
object <- glm.separate(x=x,y=y,family=family)
object <- glm.common(x=x,y=y,family=family)
object <- glm.glmtrans(x=x,y=y,family=family)
#> Registered S3 methods overwritten by 'caret':
#>   method         from
#>   predict.splsda spls
#>   print.splsda   spls
object <- glm.xrnet(x=x,y=y,family=family)
coef(object)
